name: Kepler-238
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-238 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-238 is a star with 1.8499999999999992 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.43 times its radius. It is located 6189.56 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-238 is known to have 5 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-238 b

Kepler-238 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2.09 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-238.

The mass of Kepler-238 b is 3.57 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-238 b is 1.73 that of Earth. At 3.57 Earth masses, Kepler-238 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-238 c

Kepler-238 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 6.16 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-238.

The mass of Kepler-238 c is 7.77 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-238 c is 2.39 that of Earth. At 7.77 Earth masses, Kepler-238 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-238 d

Kepler-238 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 13.23 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-238.

The mass of Kepler-238 d is 14.22 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-238 d is 3.07 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-238 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-238, which contains 5 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
